form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cornyn (for himself and Mr. Heinrich) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to submit a report on New World screwworm readiness and response.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop the Screwworms With Active Readiness and Mitigation Act of 2025 or the Stop the SWARM Act of 2025.

section.header: Report on New World screwworm readiness and response
section.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture shall submit to Congress a report on the New World Screwworm domestic readiness and response initiative of the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, with a particular focus onâ€”

subparagraph.text: domestic readiness, including the construction of a domestic production facility in the event of a threat of a domestic outbreak; and
exploring partnerships with States and industry with respect to that construction and other domestic preparedness efforts;

paragraph.text: sterile fly production technology and other eradication tools and technologies; and
the benefits of and barriers, including timelines and costs, to enhanced domestic, as compared to international, sterile fly production.
